greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} (1 - q(k)*x^k), where q(k) = number of partitions of k into distinct parts (A000009).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Partition Function Q
Index entries for sequences related to partitions
mathematica: nmax = 51; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - PartitionsQ[k] x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]
a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[-Sum[d PartitionsQ[d]^(k/d), {d, Divisors[k]}] a[n - k], {k, 1, n}]/n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 51}]
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 18 2018
